level.heading: Misdemeanor sexual abuse of a child or minor.

level.text: Whoever, being 18 years of age or older and more than 4 years older than a child, or being 18 years of age or older and being in a significant relationship with a minor, engages in sexually suggestive conduct with that child or minor shall be imprisoned for not more than 180 days, or fined not more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01, or both.

For the purposes of this section, the term "sexually suggestive conduct" means engaging in any of the following acts in a way which is intended to cause or reasonably causes the sexual arousal or sexual gratification of any person:
Touching a child or minor inside his or her clothing;
Touching a child or minor inside or outside his or her clothing close to the genitalia, anus, breast, or buttocks;
Placing one's tongue in the mouth of the child or minor; or
Touching one's own genitalia or that of a third person.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 22-4151 and § 23-581.

level.heading: Effect of Amendments
level.text: The 2013 amendment by D.C. Law 19-317 substituted "not more than the amount set forth in § 22-3571.01" for "in an amount not to exceed $1,000" in (a).
